workflow.name: Beginner's Guide to Workflow Automation with OpenAI, LangChain & API Integrations
workflow.description:
## How it works

This beginner-friendly workflow demonstrates the core building blocks of n8n. It guides you through:

 - **Triggers** ‚Äì Start workflows manually, on a schedule, via webhooks, or through chat.
- **Data processing** ‚Äì Use Set and Code nodes to create, transform, and enrich data.
 - **Logic and branching** ‚Äì Apply conditions with IF nodes and merge different branches back together.
- **API integrations** ‚Äì Fetch external data (e.g., users from an API), split arrays into individual items, and extract useful fields.
- **AI-powered steps** ‚Äì Connect to OpenAI for generating fun facts or build interactive assistants with chat triggers, memory, and tools.
- **Responses** ‚Äì Return structured results via webhooks or summary nodes.

By the end, it demonstrates a full flow: creating data ‚Üí transforming it ‚Üí making decisions ‚Üí calling APIs ‚Üí using AI ‚Üí responding with outputs.



## Set up steps

**Time required: 5‚Äì10 minutes.**

- What you need:
  - An n8n instance (cloud or self-hosted).
  - Optional: API credentials (e.g., OpenAI) if you want to test AI features.

- Setup flow:
  - Import this workflow.
  - Add your API keys where needed (OpenAI, etc.).
  - Trigger the workflow manually or test with webhooks.

>üëâ Detailed node explanations and examples are already included as sticky notes inside the workflow itself, so you can learn step by step as you explore.

parameters.content:
## Welcome to n8n!

This is a **Sticky Note** - used for documentation.

### What you'll learn:
1. **Triggers** - How workflows start
2. **Data Processing** - Manipulating data
3. **Conditionals** - Making decisions
4. **API Calls** - External integrations
5. **AI Agents** - Using LangChain

üëâ Click "Execute Workflow" to start!

## Set Node

**Purpose:** Create or modify data fields

**Key Features:**
- Add new fields to your data
- Set static or dynamic values
- Support for strings, numbers, booleans, arrays, objects

**Expressions:**
- `={{ $now }}` - Current timestamp
- `={{ $workflow.name }}` - Workflow name
- `={{ $json.fieldName }}` - Access previous data

## IF Node

**Purpose:** Conditional branching

**Outputs:**
- ‚úÖ **True** - Condition met
- ‚ùå **False** - Condition not met

**Comparison Types:**
- Number: equals, larger, smaller
- String: equals, contains, regex
- Boolean: true, false
- Array: contains, length

**Logic:**
- AND - All conditions must be true
- OR - Any condition can be true

## Merge Node

**Purpose:** Combine data streams

**Modes:**
- **Append** - Stack items
- **Combine by Position** - Merge paired items
- **Combine by Fields** - Join on matching values
- **Multiplex** - Create combinations

**Use Cases:**
- Reunite split branches
- Join data from different sources
- Create data combinations

## HTTP Request Node

**Purpose:** Call external APIs

**Methods:**
- GET - Retrieve data
- POST - Create data
- PUT/PATCH - Update data
- DELETE - Remove data

**Authentication:**
- None, Basic Auth, OAuth2
- API Key, Bearer YOUR_TOKEN_HERE

**Example:** Fetching from JSONPlaceholder API

üí° **Tip:** Test APIs with free endpoints first!

## Split Out Node

**Purpose:** Convert arrays to individual items

**Example:**
Before: 1 item with array of 10 users
After: 10 separate items

**Why?**
- Process each item individually
- Apply conditions per item
- Send separate API calls

**Pattern:**
```
HTTP Request ‚Üí Split Out ‚Üí Process Each
```

## OpenAI Integration

**Purpose:** AI-powered processing

**Setup:**
1. Add OpenAI credentials
2. Use HTTP Request node
3. Configure model & parameters

**Models:**
- gpt-4o - Most capable
- gpt-4o-mini - Fast & cost-effective
- gpt-3.5-turbo - Legacy

**Parameters:**
- temperature: 0-1 (creativity)
- max_tokens: Response length

## Webhook Node

**Purpose:** HTTP endpoint for external systems

**URL Pattern:**
`https://your-instance/webhook/path-name`

**Use Cases:**
- Receive form submissions
- Handle API callbacks
- Integrate with third-party services

**Test It:**
```bash
curl -X POST \
  https://your-n8n/webhook/beginner-webhook \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -d '{"name":"Test","value":123}'
```

options.title: n8n Beginner's Assistant
options.subtitle: Your AI helper for learning n8n

parameters.initialMessages:
Hello! I'm an n8n AI assistant. Ask me anything about n8n workflows!

Try asking:
- How do I use the IF node?
- What's the Code node for?
- How do I call external APIs?

parameters.content:
## Chat Trigger + AI Agent

**Purpose:** Create AI chatbots

**Components:**
1. **Chat Trigger** - Receives messages
2. **AI Agent** - Processes with AI
3. **Memory** - Remembers context
4. **Tools** - Actions agent can take

**Perfect for:**
- Customer support bots
- Internal assistants
- Interactive tutorials

**Try it:** Open the chat interface and ask questions!

parameters.name: get_current_time
parameters.description: Returns the current date and time. Use this when users ask about the current time, date, day of week, etc.

parameters.name: calculate
parameters.description: Performs mathematical calculations. Input should be a mathematical expression as a string, like '5 + 3' or '10 * 2'.

options.systemMessage:
=You are a helpful n8n workflow assistant for beginners.

Your role:
- Explain n8n concepts in simple terms
- Provide examples and best practices
- Help users understand nodes and their connections
- Be encouraging and patient

Key Topics:
- Triggers (Manual, Webhook, Schedule, Chat)
- Data Processing (Set, Code, Edit Fields)
- Logic (IF, Switch, Merge)
- Integrations (HTTP Request, APIs)
- AI Features (Chat Trigger, AI Agent, Tools)

Always:
- Use clear, beginner-friendly language
- Provide practical examples
- Suggest next learning steps

parameters.content:
## AI Agent Tools

**Purpose:** Give AI capabilities

**Tool Types:**
- **Code Tools** - Custom JavaScript
- **Workflow Tools** - Call other workflows
- **HTTP Tools** - API calls
- **Vector Store** - Knowledge retrieval
- **Calculator** - Math operations

**How it works:**
1. User asks question
2. AI decides which tool to use
3. Tool executes and returns result
4. AI formats response

## Schedule Trigger

**Purpose:** Run workflows on schedule

**Options:**
- **Seconds/Minutes** - Short intervals
- **Hours** - Hourly tasks
- **Days** - Daily jobs
- **Weeks** - Weekly reports
- **Cron** - Custom schedules

**Example Cron:**
- `0 9 * * 1` - Monday 9 AM
- `0 */6 * * *` - Every 6 hours
- `0 0 1 * *` - First day of month

**Use Cases:**
- Daily reports
- Data synchronization
- Cleanup tasks

assignments.name: workflow_summary
assignments.value:
=Workflow executed successfully!

Processed items: {{ $items().length }}
Timestamp: {{ $now.toISO() }}

This beginner workflow demonstrated:
- Data creation and manipulation
- Conditional logic
- API integrations
- AI capabilities

Next: Explore n8n documentation and build your own workflows!

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.
